title: Antarctica
description: In January 2022, my wife and I went on our (delayed by 1.5 years) honeymoon to Antarctica with National Geographic/Lindblad Expeditions. We started from the southernmost point of Argentina and spent 2 weeks cruising around the edge of the Antarctic peninsula with a few shore excursions.

photos.description: A plane landing at the Ushuaia airport.
photos.alt: A plane landing over the water with mountains in the background.

photos.description: A glacier with layers of volcanic ash.
photos.alt: A glacier with layers of black volcanic ash.

photos.description: A leopard seal yawning on an ice floe. Taken from about 100ft away in an inflatable Zodiac, which they are apparently known to pop.
photos.alt: A yawning leopard seal lying on its side on an ice floe.

photos.description: An orca and a Minke whale. This was one of two fairly large pods of orcas we saw.
photos.alt: An orca swimming towards a Minke whale, both partially breaching the surface of the ocean.

photos.description: Some porpoising Adélie penguins.
photos.alt: A group of penguins leaping out of the water and diving back in.

photos.description: The antarctic continent. Taken after hiking up a hill and it was actually pretty warm with the sun out (~40°F).
photos.alt: A wide landscape with mostly very bright white ice and snow.

photos.description: A Weddell seal trying to nap.
photos.alt: A Weddell seal lying on its side with its eyes closed.

photos.description: Two Adélie penguins considering sliding down the hill.
photos.alt: Two penguins on a hill looking to the side.

photos.description: A Gentoo penguin chick following its parent. There were thousands of these things in the colony and they smelled awful.
photos.alt: A penguin chick following behind an adult penguin. Many other penguins in the background.

photos.description: Adélie penguins diving into the water from an iceberg.
photos.alt: A penguin diving off an iceberg into the water with others watching.

photos.description: Two Adélie penguins chattering at each other. Taken with a very cool, very heavy 600mm telephoto lens that I was able to borrow from National Geographic for the duration of the trip.
photos.alt: Two penguins facing each other with their beaks open.

photos.description: Some Adélie penguins lining up very nicely for their portraits.
photos.alt: A penguin head and torso leaning in from the left with a few other penguins in a line down the center at increasing distances.

photos.description: A humpback breaching out of the water. There was actually another one doing this simultaneously out of frame to the right, but I didn't get it.
photos.alt: A humpback whale breaching out of the ocean.

photos.description: An Adélie penguin demonstrating how they get up on the icebergs. They don't jump high enough and slip off pretty often.
photos.alt: A penguin jumping up onto an iceberg from the ocean with a water jet trail behind it. Several other penguins are climbing up the iceberg as well.

photos.description: A colony of over 1.5 million Adélies on Paulet island.
photos.alt: Many penguins standing in close proximity on a rocky island.

photos.description: An Adélie staring me down out of the crowd.
photos.alt: Many penguins out of focus in the foreground with a single focused penguin in the center staring directly into the camera.

photos.description: A spy-hopping orca. This was the second pod that the crew woke us up at 3:45 AM to see.
photos.alt: An orca head peeking out of the ocean.

photos.description: The sun "rising" over a ridge. Since it was summer, the sun never fully set below the horizon, so this blueish light is about as dark as it got.
photos.alt: The sun starting to appear over a snow-covered ridge.

photos.description: A mountain reflected in the water.
photos.alt: A snow-covered mountain reflected in very still water.

photos.description: A bunch of very picturesque sea ice. The ship had broken through it only about 20 minutes earlier, but it reforms very quickly.
photos.alt: A snow-covered mountain with fog around it in the background and sheets of sea ice packed densely in the foreground.

photos.description: A Gentoo going for a stroll.
photos.alt: A penguin walking from right to left with mountains in the background.

photos.description: A diving humpback's tail.
photos.alt: A humpback's tail dripping with water as it dives and mountains in the background.

photos.description: A preening Gentoo.
photos.alt: A penguin with its head tilted down against its wing.

photos.description: A Gentoo waddling towards me down one of the "highways" that they dig out by walking over the same path.
photos.alt: A penguin walking towards the camera down a narrow groove in the snow.
